artifact.art_title: The system shall provide support for an unlimited number of customized forms.
Orders shall be defined by the user.
Resources shall be defined by the user.
Appointment types shall be defined by the user.
Menu bars and toolbars in tables, forms, and controls shall be customizable according to individual users, roles, and groups.
User interface shall be customizable using Javascript
Quick registration forms shall be created and edited in a form editor.
Outpatient registration forms shall be created and edited in a form editor.
Inpatient registration forms shall be created and edited in a form editor.
The form editor will provide support for defining required fields.
The form editor will support customization of data entry rules.
The form editor will allow the user to define recommended fields to highlight.
Forms will provide support to auto populate fields.
Forms will provide support for checking input format.
The registration process will generate HL7 Interface transactions for ADT outbound.
Scheduling shall support day, week, and month views for provider.
Scheduling shall support day, week, and month views for multiple providers.
The appointment Type editor shall provide support for appointment types of any duration including multi-block staggered duration.
Appointment types must be colorable with a user-defined color scheme.
Resources with custom schedules can be created using the Resource Editor.
Schedules with recurring blocked times, double or any amount of overbooking inserting slots shall be customizable at specific times.
The calendar must allow users to block off schedules.
User shall be able to personalize the resources viewed.
Test results shall be viewable in a compact grid format.
View results received from an HL7 interface with a lab system (ORU^R01).
The system must support an unlimited number of custom forms using the clinical forms editor.
Users shall be able to define their own fields and data elements to capture in clinical forms.
Users shall be able to define their own fields and data elements to capture in administrative forms.
Complex paper forms shall be scanned as images.
Discrete data elements shall be bound to clinical and administrative forms.
Ink directory on the form.
Print inked form or view flowsheet.
Medications will be integrated with Medispan supplemented with PatientOS screening.
The system shall automatically perform drug-drug interaction checking.
The system shall automatically perform allergy checking.
The system shall automatically perform dose checking.
The system shall automatically check for adverse drug effects against medical conditions.
The system shall include a prescription wizard which provides dispense and dose instructions.
Unlimited number of lab tests can be created using the Lab Test Editor.
Generate HL7 Interface transactions for orders outbound (ORU^O01).
General care orders shall be created using the General Care Order Editor.
Lab orders with standard or custom tests shall be created using the Lab Order Editor.
Custom order entry fields shall be created using the Form and Order Format Editor.
The system shall manage charges.
The system shall allow manual charge entries to be made into the patient chart.
Each patient shall be assigned a patient portal login.
A sample patient form shall be provided that writes directly to the chart.
The system shall support mass emails to patients.
Users shall be able to create standalone reports.
Standard reports shall be generated for user viewing.
Generate XML based reports to leverage domain models.
Manage users and multiple roles per user using the User Editor.
Create custom batch jobs for repeated execution.
Create custom schedules for batch jobs.
Import/Export users to XML for system or environment migration.
The admission, progress, discharge and other clinical notes shall support categorization of clinical terms and templates.
The admission, progress, discharge and other clinical notes shall support symptoms, findings, problems, procedures, and diagnoses.
Notes and forms shall have integrated medication or prescription orders.
Templates can be merged, automatically applying for diagnoses, symptoms or reason for visit.
Create charge items with associated charges or billing codes
Integrate charges into forms
Generate charges as part of the clinical documentation
Integrate outbound charges using HL7 DFT transaction using Mirth
Provide real-time control over outbound charges using a custom controller on the forms that contain charges
Support batch job sending out all charges over an HTTP, XML, SOAP interface.
Provide a full features claims and invoicing billing system for both ambulatory and physicians
Support basic inventory management
Provide toolbar access to labs
Provide toolbar access to nursing forms
Provide toolbar access to graphs
Ship claims items that easily map to the ADT interface to the HCFA 1500 Claims form
Generate mapping code for the Mirth HL7 integration engine directly from the registration form editor.
Provide a clinical messages module to allow communication between physicians related to patient care and medication.
A physician shall place a medication order.
The pharmacy shall approve the medication order.
The pharmacy shall track the dispensing of medication.
Labels shall be printed for each medication dispensed to a patient.
The system shall allow a nurse to review the medication orders.
All medication shall be barcoded
The pharmacy module shall support eMAR administration.
The database enforces a unique username using Lightweight Directory Access Protocol (LDAP) for authentication.
A customized workflow can be created to provide emergency access to electronic PHI during an emergency.
Automatic timeout can be specified by role.
Automatic timeout can be specified by location.
When the system timeouts, the user is returned to the login page to sign in again.
The database can be encrypted
SSL shall be used to encrypt the communication between the client and the server.
Individual fields can be encrypted.
Access to each chart is logged, there are varying levels of auditing that can be turned on - such as auditing opening a form
Custom auditing can be plugged in for various events.
Role based security defines what each user can and cannot do - defined by the organization during implementation/configuration of the product
